00019 
00020 /**
00021  * @defgroup ApnsPHP_Feedback Feedback
00022  * @ingroup ApplePushNotificationService
00023  */
00024 
00025 /**
00026  * The Feedback Service client.
00027  *
00028  * Apple Push Notification Service includes a feedback service that APNs continually
00029  * updates with a per-application list of devices for which there were failed-delivery
00030  * attempts. Providers should periodically query the feedback service to get the
00031  * list of device tokens for their applications, each of which is identified by
00032  * its topic. Then, after verifying that the application hasn’t recently been re-registered
00033  * on the identified devices, a provider should stop sending notifications to these
00034  * devices.
00035  *
00036  * @ingroup ApnsPHP_Feedback
00037  * @see http://tinyurl.com/ApplePushNotificationFeedback
00038  */
00039 class ApnsPHP_Feedback extends ApnsPHP_Abstract
00040 {
00041     const TIME_BINARY_SIZE = 4; /**< @type integer Timestamp binary size in bytes. */
00042     const TOKEN_LENGTH_BINARY_SIZE = 2; /**< @type integer Token length binary size in bytes. */
00043 
00044     protected $_aServiceURLs = array(
00045         'ssl://feedback.push.apple.com:2196', // Production environment
00046         'ssl://feedback.sandbox.push.apple.com:2196' // Sandbox environment
00047     ); /**< @type array Feedback URLs environments. */
00048 
00049     protected $_aFeedback; /**< @type array Feedback container. */
00050 
00051     /**
00052      * Receives feedback tuples from Apple Push Notification Service feedback.
00053      *
00054      * Every tuple (array) contains:
00055      * @li @c timestamp indicating when the APNs determined that the application
00056      *     no longer exists on the device. This value represents the seconds since
00057      *     1970, anchored to UTC. You should use the timestamp to determine if the
00058      *     application on the device re-registered with your service since the moment
00059      *     the device token was recorded on the feedback service. If it hasn’t,
00060      *     you should cease sending push notifications to the device.
00061      * @li @c tokenLength The length of the device token (usually 32 bytes).
00062      * @li @c deviceToken The device token.
00063      *
00064      * @return @type array Array of feedback tuples (array).
00065      */
00066     public function receive()
00067     {
00068         $nFeedbackTupleLen = self::TIME_BINARY_SIZE + self::TOKEN_LENGTH_BINARY_SIZE + self::DEVICE_BINARY_SIZE;
00069 
00070         $this->_aFeedback = array();
00071         $sBuffer = '';
00072         while (!feof($this->_hSocket)) {
00073             $this->_log('INFO: Reading...');
00074             $sBuffer .= $sCurrBuffer = fread($this->_hSocket, 8192);
00075             $nCurrBufferLen = strlen($sCurrBuffer);
00076             if ($nCurrBufferLen > 0) {
00077                 $this->_log("INFO: {$nCurrBufferLen} bytes read.");
00078             }
00079             unset($sCurrBuffer, $nCurrBufferLen);
00080 
00081             $nBufferLen = strlen($sBuffer);
00082             if ($nBufferLen >= $nFeedbackTupleLen) {
00083                 $nFeedbackTuples = floor($nBufferLen / $nFeedbackTupleLen);
00084                 for ($i = 0; $i < $nFeedbackTuples; $i++) {
00085                     $sFeedbackTuple = substr($sBuffer, 0, $nFeedbackTupleLen);
00086                     $sBuffer = substr($sBuffer, $nFeedbackTupleLen);
00087                     $this->_aFeedback[] = $aFeedback = $this->_parseBinaryTuple($sFeedbackTuple);
00088                     $this->_log(sprintf("INFO: New feedback tuple: timestamp=%d (%s), tokenLength=%d, deviceToken=%s.",
00089                         $aFeedback['timestamp'], date('Y-m-d H:i:s', $aFeedback['timestamp']),
00090                         $aFeedback['tokenLength'], $aFeedback['deviceToken']
00091                     ));
00092                     unset($aFeedback);
00093                 }
00094             }
00095 
00096             $read = array($this->_hSocket);
00097             $null = NULL;
00098             $nChangedStreams = stream_select($read, $null, $null, 0, $this->_nSocketSelectTimeout);
00099             if ($nChangedStreams === false) {
00100                 $this->_log('WARNING: Unable to wait for a stream availability.');
00101                 break;
00102             }
00103         }
00104         return $this->_aFeedback;
00105     }
00106 
00107     /**
00108      * Parses binary tuples.
00109      *
00110      * @param  $sBinaryTuple @type string A binary tuple to parse.
00111      * @return @type array Array with timestamp, tokenLength and deviceToken keys.
00112      */
00113     protected function _parseBinaryTuple($sBinaryTuple)
00114     {
00115         return unpack('Ntimestamp/ntokenLength/H*deviceToken', $sBinaryTuple);
00116     }
00117 }
